questions.question: What is an inference?

choices.answer: When an author uses negative connotations in a text.
Something that the text says explicitly.
Conclusions that a reader reaches based on clues.
None of the above.

questions.question: What had Ted concluded?

choices.answer: That nobody was home
That Pete was not really his friend.
That Pete is a liar.
That Pete had been bored to sleep.

questions.question: Which clue supports the inference: the plants were drooping because Mary had not watered them?

choices.answer: Mary pulled the weeds everyday.
She had not watered them.
Mary was at the movies all day.
All of the above.

questions.question: What does Mr. Johnson do for a living?

choices.answer: He is a priest.
He stays at home.
He is a scientist who observes crops.
He is a farmer.

questions.question: Why is Mr. Johnson cursing the sun?

choices.answer: There has been too much sun drying up the land.
He is sunburnt.
He has to go to church because it is sunny.
He prefers cold weather.

questions.question: Why does Mr. Johnson go to church at the end of the passage?

choices.answer: He had no excuse because it wasn't raining.
He went to pray for the sun to go away.
It was Sunday.
To ask for forgiveness for cursing the sun.

questions.question: What is Warren doing?

choices.answer: He is moving a dead body.
He is helping with construction work.
He is taking out the trash.
He is trying to run away.

questions.question: Why does Warren get so angry when the bag spills on his leg?

choices.answer: Now he has to start over.
Those are his favorite pants!
He will get in really big trouble.
The liquid is from the trash and is gross.

questions.question: Why is Virgil upset?

choices.answer: He doesn't like school.
He is locked out of his locker and late for class.
He was left alone in the hallway.
Somebody stole his things.

questions.question: Why did Virgil go to look for a custodian at the end of the passage?

choices.answer: He needed company.
He went to yell at somebody about his locker.
He went to ask a custodian to remove the lock.
The custodian is his father.

questions.question: What is Iggy doing in this building?

choices.answer: Iggy is buying his groceries.
Iggy is skiing.
Iggy is robbing them.
Iggy is their boss.

questions.question: Why does Iggy tip "an imaginary hat to the woman"?

choices.answer: He is used to having a hat.
He is trying to be cool, adding insult to injury.
That is the custom where he is.
He likes the woman.

questions.question: Why does Iggy return inside of the building after having left?

choices.answer: The police are outside.
He forgot something.
He wanted that lady's number.
It's too cold out.

questions.question: Why is Missy in such a bad mood?

choices.answer: She hates being with her brother?
Kirk said something rude to her.
She in unable to complete the puzzle.

questions.question: Why is Missy specifically mad at Kirk?

choices.answer: Kirk is always annoying.
He lost the last puzzle piece.
Kirk has been arguing with her all day.

questions.question: What is Pam doing?

choices.answer: She is delivering a package.
She is driving with her father to a new place.
Taking a driving test.

questions.question: Who is the man with Pam?

choices.answer: Her father.
An old man who needed a ride.
Her teacher.
The driving test administrator.

questions.question: What information is the man putting on his clipboard?

choices.answer: He is writing how she is doing.
He is writing down the information about where he is going
He is writing a letter

questions.question: What problem is Amber having?

choices.answer: Amber does not want to date Scott.
Her mother is being annoying.
She cannot decide what she wants to wear.

questions.question: Will Amber be ready to meet Scott in two minutes? Why or why not?

choices.answer: Yes, because she gets dressed really quickly.
No, because she has given up.
Yes, because she has decided what to wear.
No, because she is still trying to find an outfit.
